newsitem.title: POLAND: POLISA WANTS 4.3 MLN SHARES ON OTC MARKET.
newsitem.headline: POLISA WANTS 4.3 MLN SHARES ON OTC MARKET.

text.p: Polish insurer TUR Polisa SA wants to place some 4.3 million shares not trading on the main market of the Warsaw bourse on the over the counter market (OTC) by mid-December, the firm's deputy-president said.
"We want to place 4,271,541 shares on the OTC market...and I think that the debut will be around mid-December," Zygfryd Kielarski told Reuters on Tuesday.

Kielarski said Polisa's board filed to place the shares on the newly created OTC market Centralna Tabela Ofert (CTO), because of tax breaks on capital gains done on shares which were floated but were aquired before the firm became public.

"If the shares are sold on the CTO market by the end of the year they will not be taxed, even if they are bought-back," Kielarski said, adding that such a move would be taxed in 1997, according to a new law.
He said that most likely in early January Polisa, who entered the bourse in late November, would apply to move its CTO shares to the bourse.
Polisa currently has 4.1 million shares traded on the main market of the Warsaw bourse.
